model

Class Month

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Month
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Month
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This represents a Month of a calendar, and uses the Week, Day, Year, and Event classes to model a month, as well as CalendarView in order to allow the view to access the month to present visually.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Month(java.lang.String name, int year)
      Constructor, takes in the month name, year its in, and the view

    • Constructor Detail

      • Month

        public Month(java.lang.String name,
             int year)
        Constructor, takes in the month name, year its in, and the view
        Parameters:
        name - The month name
        year - The year the month is in
        view - The view the month will be looked at in The method takes in the above parameters, and first uses the get offset method to figure out on what day of the week the month actually starts on in the given year. The method then uses the name to figure out how many days are in the month and creates the array of day objects accordingly.

    • Method Detail

      • setDay

        public void setDay(Day day,
                   int dayNum)
        Sets the Day object at the given dayNum in the array to the Day object that is passed in.
        Parameters:
        day - The day object to set into the array
        dayNum - The index at which to put in the Day object The method sets the day object at the inputed index minus one to the given day (this is so that the days of the week are more intuitively numbered for the view). The Month then calls the observable setChanged and notifyObservers methods.

      • getDay

        public Day getDay(int dayNum)
        Returns the Day object at the dayNum inputed (the date)
        Parameters:
        dayNum - The date at which to grab the Day object
        Returns:
        Day the grabbed day object This method takes in the int dayNum (which is the date) and returns the Day object at that given date, or null if the date is not valid for the month.

      • getDays

        public Day[] getDays()
        Returns the day array of the month
        Returns:
        Day[] the array of Day objects This method simply returns the array of Day objects.

      • getNumDays

        public int getNumDays()
        Returns the number of days in the month
        Returns:
        int the month's number of days This method simply returns the number of days in the month.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the month name
        Returns:
        String the month name This method simply returns the name of the month as a String.

      • getYear

        public int getYear()
        Returns the year in which the month is
        Returns:
        int The month's year This method simply returns the year the month is in as an integer.
